job.title: Software Engineer (Remote)
job.description: We are looking for a full stack .NET Engineer to join the Broadlume team. You’ll take ownership for evolving and maintaining our C# ASP.NET codebase, including using best practices around style guides, frameworks, and automated unit and integration testing. You’ll work on applications used by our operations team and our customers to manage thousands of small businesses nationwide.This is a full time, remote position**What You’ll DoFind solutions for the most unique and challenging customer requests, integrating new products into our ecosystem of offeringsBuild out tools and applications that power a massive product inventory system.Provide technical leadership for our .NET codebases and act as a mentor for other engineers on the team. Partner with engineers on our distributed teams to help architect a unified experience for our customers to access multiple applications they rely on to run their businesses. Who You AreRequirements3+ years with C# ASP.NET (including MVC, Web API, Entity Framework)Experience with optimizing SQL queries for performance; building stored procedures, database views, functions, and triggersYou enjoy working with T-SQL. (Due to complexity in the database, complex database operations are written in T-SQL and not through Entity Framework)Strong HTML/CSS skills, and expertise with JavaScript/TypeScript and modernJavaScript frameworks such as React, Angular or VueJsA philosophy that investing time in code reviews, mentorship, and automated testing helps a team move fasterYou have experience with Microsoft SQL Server administration, maintaining IIS in productionYou are knowledgeable about .NET concepts like Lambda Expressions, LINQ queriesNICE TO HAVESYou have crossed paths with Microsoft Azure, particularly Azure Pipelines for CI/CD previouslyFamiliarity with Google Cloud for CI/CDYou want to learn more about or have experience in PHP, Ruby, or ReactExperience or interest in Docker/KubernetesYou are familiar with Rackspace architectureYou are comfortable working with git and GitHubExperience or interest in MongoDBYou can contribute to designing good APIs, understanding of ReST/JSON and GraphQLBenefitsHealth Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)Retirement Plan (401k, 4% match)Life InsuranceUnlimited Paid Time Off Family LeaveShort Term & Long Term DisabilityWork From HomeWellness ResourcesWho We AreOur mission at Broadlume is pretty simple simplify the complicated world of digital marketing for the flooring industry. The opportunity is massive, and we have the team to execute the vision…except, well, for you.At Broadlume, we are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please email us at careers@broadlume.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.Broadlume is an equal opportunity employer.
